definition: lit. prodigious abundance of fruit (idiom)/fruit hangs heavy on the bough/fig. countless accomplishments/one great result after another
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated

sentences.english: The fields in autumn are fruity.
The branches hung down to the ground with the weight of the apples.
sentences.chinese: 果實累累的蘋果樹枝低垂到地面。

sentences.english: The trees were bowed down with the weight of their fruit.
sentences.chinese: 這些樹果實累累，把樹枝都壓彎了。

sentences.english: There are indeed many fruit here.
sentences.chinese: 這裏可真是果實累累啊。

sentences.english: The bough was loaded with fruit.
A colourful fruit tree? Blossoming flowers? What do you see?
sentences.chinese: 我看到果實累累的果樹，繁花似錦的花圃。你呢？
